abstract: A deal to let Google profit from digital books raises questions about fairness and privacy.
snippet: A deal to let Google profit from digital books raises questions about fairness and privacy.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  A growing chorus of authors, academics and other book industry figures is objecting to the settlement of a class-action suit that would allow Google to profit from digital versions of millions of books it has scanned from libraries.

headline.main: Lawyer and Author Adds His Objections to Settling the Google Book Lawsuit
headline.print_headline: Lawyer and Author Adds His Objections to Settling the Google Book Lawsuit

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Motoko Rich

abstract: A growing chorus of authors, academics and other book industry figures is objecting to the settlement of a class-action suit that would allow Google to profit from digital versions of millions of books it has scanned from libraries.
snippet: A growing chorus of authors, academics and other book industry figures is objecting to the settlement of a class-action suit that would allow Google to profit from digital versions of millions of books it has scanned from libraries.
lead_paragraph: A growing chorus of authors, academics and other book industry figures is objecting to the settlement of a class-action suit that would allow Google to profit from digital versions of millions of books it has scanned from libraries, The New York Times’s Miguel Helft and Motoko Rich wrote.

headline.main: Lawyer-Author Adds Objections to Settling With Google

abstract: Five years ago today, Google sold shares to the public for the first time, amid lots of skepticism about how the offering was being handled and whether the Web search company was overhyped and overvalued.
snippet: Five years ago today, Google sold shares to the public for the first time, amid lots of skepticism about how the offering was being handled and whether the Web search company was overhyped and overvalued.

abstract: When Google first sold shares to the public five years ago, many people thought the shares were overvalued. They were wrong.
snippet: When Google first sold shares to the public five years ago, many people thought the shares were overvalued. They were wrong.

headline.main: Looking Back at Google’s I.P.O. Five Years Ago

abstract: Is it possible to move all my addresses and messages from AOL to Gmail?
snippet: Is it possible to move all my addresses and messages from AOL to Gmail?
lead_paragraph: Q. I have America Online, but since I already have a broadband connection, I’d like to change over to a Gmail account. Is it possible to move all my addresses and messages from AOL to Gmail?

headline.main: A Simple Way to Move to Gmail
headline.print_headline: A Simple Way to Move to Gmail
